definition: to widen
to increase/to expand/to add
surname Guang
wide/numerous/to spread

sentences.english: Then, the suboptimal control law is achieved using the dynamic programming principle.
sentences.chinese: 然後，使用動態規劃得到增廣系統的次優控制律。

sentences.english: Broaden students' knowledge of broadband circuits for optical communications.
sentences.chinese: 增廣光通訊用寬頻電路的知識。

sentences.english: It is generally thought that traveling abroad can enrich one's knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 一般認爲出國旅遊可增廣見聞。

sentences.english: Firstly, the extend error state model of the land inertial system is derived.
sentences.chinese: 文中，首先推導了陸用慣性系統的增廣誤差狀態模型。

sentences.english: I thank Rotary for broadening my perspective and changing my life.
sentences.chinese: 我深信扶輪增廣我的視野並且改變我們一生。

sentences.english: Discrete optimal control algorithm can be designed based on the augmented state system.
sentences.chinese: 則離散時滯最優控制律可以針對增廣的系統進行設計。

sentences.english: A variable-order recursive extended least squares method and a new criterion of order estimation is derived in the paper .
sentences.chinese: 本文給出變階式遞推增廣的最小二乘法及階估計準則。

sentences.english: Therefore, we should all strive to learn as much as we can and broaden our horizons .
sentences.chinese: 因此我們皆應努力盡量多學習並增廣我們的見識。

sentences.english: The discrete performance index is also transformed into an augmenting form.
sentences.chinese: 離散形式的性能指標也轉化成增廣形式。

sentences.english: In this paper, a new method for finding the augmented matrix is presented.
sentences.chinese: 本文給出了求取增廣矩陣的一個新方法。

sentences.english: You may be somewhat naïve, and you may need to be more realistic and informed.
sentences.chinese: 你可能有些單純，需要更現實和增廣見聞。

definition: to be in overall charge/to oversee
to spread/to hand down/to disseminate
Your presence brings light to my humble dwelling/see also 蓬蓽生光|蓬荜生光[peng2 bi4 sheng1 guang1]
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
common saying/idiom
to translate/to interpret
to exhort (sb) to live a virtuous life (Buddhism)/to beg for alms
to discuss
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to expound/to propagate
when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
grand event/magnificent undertaking
the Four Noble Truths (Buddhism)/see also 四諦|四谛[si4 di4] and 苦集滅道|苦集灭道[ku3 ji2 mie4 dao4]
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
